alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Greene; Western Columbia; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 11:28AM EST until January 20 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of a coating up to two inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Northwestern Connecticut and Columbia, western Ulster, and Greene Counties in eastern New York. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 1 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute today and the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin early this afternoon as a mix of rain and sleet. A brief period of snow may occur later this afternoon, then precipitation will transition to rain and freezing drizzle tonight. Rain and snow showers will continue on Friday with small accumulations of snow, mainly over higher elevations.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Greene; Western Columbia; Western Greene; Western Ulster
